description: Building is fun, but &&6building with the normal Minecraft inventory sucks.&&r
See below for some helpful keybinds relating to building.

&&7[ItemSwapper]&&r Press and hold &&7[&&r&&6TAB&&r&&7]&&r to open up a UI that will let you swap anything from your hand with things in your inventory. Much faster than Shift-Clicking. You can also set up block palettes that will let you easily swap between similar items.

&&7[Reacharound]&&r When a &&3visual [- -] indicator&&r appears at the crosshair, you can place blocks on &&dnormally unreachable sides&&r - Useful for building &&dbridges, walls, and downward staircases&&r.

&&7[Sophisticated Backpacks]&&r Craft a backpack, and upgrade it with all kinds of modules to help you /6/hold items, tools, even feed yourself and craft on the go!/6/ Press &&7[&&r&&6C&&r&&7]&&r to open the backpack when it's on your back. Be warned - carrying more than two backpacks at once will slow you down a lot.
There are many other blocks and items to help with building easily. Take a look through your REI for more building tools and items!
A useful one is the Toolbox from Create - You can hold &&7[&&r&&6ALT&&r&&7]&&r when a toolbox is nearby to see all of the items inside and quickly swap to them. Great for building!
Here's a /6/Bundle/6/ to get you started - it will let you pick up the various bits and bobs you grab while finding a place to settle.

In your inventory, you can grab the Bundle and hold &&7[&&r&&6RIGHT-CLICK&&r&&7]&&r and drag it over various items in your inventory to place them in the bundle. You can do the same with empty slots to get the items back, or hold it in your hand and Right-Click in the world and it'll dump it all out.
